title: Principle Studios
description: Architect and lead developer for First American Home Warranty's user and contractor portals, which consisted of four distinct applications. These were built using React, Typescript, React Hooks, and React Query, on NX, with a C#/.NET backend.
highlights: Complex data/user flows
Prioritizing/Strategy sessions with the Product Owner
Negotiate scope, assess impact and mitigate risk
Shortened timeline due to Microsoft deprecating Angular 1.x
Involved complete refactor of existing codebase
Coded major pages, components, and services

title: Stackpath
description: A pioneers of edge delivery, StackPath offered a blazingly fast CDN, DNS, robust WAF, cutting edge Edge Computing, serverless scripting, as well as comprehensive monitoring and security tools.
highlights: Frontend built using React, Typescript, Apollo Server/Client, and GraphQL
Integrated websockets to provide real-time analytics to user dashboards
Advanced tooling to generate graphQL layer from gRPC/protobufs
Updated sites with new offerings, including serverless scripting and edge computing
Created custom React charts and components for user dashboards

title: Intuit
description: Converted to full-time as a Software Engineer II, I was responsible for the development of the ProConnect Link application, which allowed accounts to share and track user progress in real time
highlights: Built components used by entire Intuit ecosystem, including TurboTax, QuickBooks, and Mint
Advanced document scanning functionality with auto-filling into corresponding tax forms
Micro-application architecture using React, Redux, Redux-Saga, and GraphQL
Integrated with third-party services, such as DocuSign, to provide a seamless user experience
Proposed and implemented a new feature that allowed accounts to custom email templates to clients

title: Copart
description: Built a native mobile application, using the brand new React Native, that offered advanced searching and filtering on vehicles, as well as the ability to bid on vehicles in real-time auctions.
highlights: VIN Barcode/License Plate scanner using device camera
Real-time bidding updates using websockets
Shared mobile and web view using React Native, React, and Redux

title: Southwest Airlines
description: As a core member of the WCM team, I was responsible for identifying commonalities in marketing designs for creating reusable React fragments to deliver on various devices and platforms.
highlights: Used Interwoven to create and manage forms and tools for marketing
Created XML transformation to React JSX fragment using XPath
Worked with various teams to identify device constraints
Wrote ElasticSearch queries for faster search and ad results

title: Ascend Marketing
description: As Lead, I was responsible for the overall digital marketing strategy, which included creating microsites and corresponding databases for lead generation. I also helped train and mentor contractors and junior employees.
highlights: Build email campaigns and landing pages for marketing campaigns using Angular and WordPress
Created custom WordPress plugins using PHP, JavaScript & Angular
Setup MySQL databases and tables for storing lead data
Defined and executed queries to retrieve relevant leads for marketing campaigns
Identified SEO opportunities and implemented changes to improve search rankings

title: AuditionU
description: As QA Lead, I was responsible for identifying and fixing bugs while finalizing the product before launch.
highlights: Used Redmine to track identified issues
Regression test entire application on specified devices and browsers
Work with founder to prioritize and fix issues before launch

title: Dasha Designs
description: Responsible for updating multiple sites with new products, as well as creating new pages and features. I also worked with the owner to create new sites for new brands.
highlights: Added custom functionality to site using PHP, JavaScript and jQuery
Updated sites with new products and features
Kept sites up-to-date with latest web standards and best practices
Use PhotoShop to create marketing images for new products
Used iMovie for video demos of new products

title: Low Price Skates
description: My first professional job, I was responsible for updating the site with new products, as well as creating new pages and features. I also worked with the owner to create a new site for a recently aquired brand.
highlights: Used xCart to create new site, based on three existing sites
Updated sites with new products and features
Captured photos and videos of new products for marketing purposes
Kept sites up-to-date with latest web standards and best practices

title: MySpace
description: Where I really honed my skills as a developer and designer. I'll never forget the 3-day stretch where I worked endlessly to create a blank canvas layout that ended up being used by thousands of pages.
highlights: Quite a few hard times with CSS
Designed and built layouts for groups, bands, friends, and family
Used PhotoShop to plan and create custom images for pages
Created and moderated forums using phpBB3

title: Neopets
description: The start of my late nights working with web technologies. I spent countless hours learning HTML, CSS, as well as how to use PhotoShop to create custom layouts and images for guilds and bulletin postings.
highlights: Sold layouts to guilds with 1000+ members for NeoPoints
Used PhotoShop to create custom images based on buyer's requests
Manipulated HTML and CSS to create custom layouts for guilds and bulletin postings
Prompted Google to find examples of code to create custom features for guilds
Researched solutions to problems on forums and chat rooms

title: The Beginning
description:
My family got our first computer in 1995, and I was instantly hooked. I quickly realized web pages could be saved and modified locally, and I started learning HTML. My neighbor was an ex-Intuit, soon-to-be Google, employee gave me a few broken computers from his garage. After a quick hard drive swap, and some doubling up of the RAM, I soon realized I had a computer running Windows 95 and a valid copy of PhotoShop 3.0. I was in heaven. I quickly mastered Office, having the most fun with PowerPoint, and would help my parents with presentations for work. By the age of 8, I could disassemble and assemble computers easily, and had started hosting sites on geoCities. By 11, I had a AIM chatbot being used by hundreds. 
 Also thousands of hours managing and building in:
highlights: 2000 - The Sims
1998 - Theme Hospital
1996 - RollerCoaster Tycoon
